items.title: 'Ironic' and 'lazy' AI-generated images shared on Queensland government department social media accounts
items.summary: A Queensland government department has urged social media users not to trust AI through the use of an AI-generated image.

items.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
items.summary: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

items.title: Man allegedly pretended to fire on people near bridge where Bondi terror attack occurred
items.summary: A man accused of mimicking firing on people near the pedestrian bridge where the Bondi terror attack occurred has been denied bail.

items.title: Mother shares concerns about treatment at Toowoomba Hospital amid culture review
items.summary: A confrontation caught on body-worn security footage in the halls of the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit highlights concerns raised by local mothers.

items.title: Grandmother removed from Toowoomba birth suite by security
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Fears SA's endangered glossy black-cockatoo eggs will 'cook' in nesting boxes during heatwave
items.summary: South Australia's population of a unique subspecies of glossy black-cockatoos is heavily dependent on artificial nesting boxes. That could pose a problem during extreme heat conditions.

items.title: Report calls for Australia to grow security, trade and diplomatic ties with Taiwan because of China's influence
items.summary: Experts say Australia needs to do more to grow its relationship with Taiwan as China works to diplomatically isolate Taipei in the region.

items.title: In Zak Hilditch's horror movie We Bury the Dead, the zombie apocalypse devastates Tasmania
items.summary: These Final Hours writer and director Zak Hilditch drew on personal tragedy to produce We Bury the Dead, his biggest cinematic epic yet.

items.title: Psychiatrist of Westfield Bondi Junction attacker referred for review by coroner
items.summary: Findings from the coronial inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing have been handed down, almost two years on from the attack.

items.title: Report points to exploitation, Medicare and visa concerns in Pacific islander jobs scheme
items.summary: Changing jobs is a basic right for most people, but it is not so simple for Pacific Australia Labour Mobility workers.

items.title: Online safety watchdog says tech giants failing to detect child abuse
items.summary: Major tech companies including Apple, Google, Meta and Microsoft are still failing to do enough to detect and stop child sexual abuse, eSafety has claimed.

items.title: Attorney-General asked anti-corruption chief to explain himself after Defence ties emerged
items.summary: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland asked Paul Brereton to explain why his ongoing ties to Defence had not been "adequately" disclosed in a letter sent last year.

items.title: A 'ghost airport' and sinkhole highway as Timor-Leste gambles on oil and gas with Greater Sunrise project
items.summary: The Greater Sunrise gas project was meant to transform Timor-Leste and bring billions in revenue, but locals are still waiting for the jobs and opportunities that were promised.

items.title: 'Bloodbath' at Washington Post as massive layoffs announced
items.summary: The Jeff Bezos-owned paper, which famously brought down US President Richard Nixon, will drastically cut back in size and lay off workers in all its departments.

items.title: Winter Olympics quiz: How well are you prepared for the Games?
items.summary: The Winter Olympics gets underway in Milan Cortina this week — but how much do you know about the Winter Olympics? Test yourself in our fiendish quiz.

items.title: Ryan Routh sentenced to life in prison for attempted assassination of Donald Trump on Florida golf course
items.summary: Ryan Routh will spend the rest of his life behind bars for his 2024 assassination attempt on the then US presidential hopeful.

items.title: Trump administration pulls 700 immigration officers out of Minnesota
items.summary: The administration's border tsar says the decision came after local and state authorities agreed to cooperate more closely with its immigration crackdown.

items.title: Marius Borg Høiby, son of Norwegian crown princess, denies rape charges in testimony
items.summary: Marius Borg Høiby is pleading not guilty to the most serious charges of rape and domestic violence but admits some lesser charges, including driving too fast.

items.title: Xi Jinping speaks with Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump on eve of Ukraine war anniversary
items.summary: The Chinese leader and his Russian counterpart hail the success of the relationship between the two countries and pledge to further ties in a call broadcast on state television.

items.title: At least seven killed by Russian cluster munitions attacks in Ukraine-controlled Donetsk, governor says
items.summary: Another round of US-brokered talks on ending the almost four-year war began as Russian cluster munitions killed seven people at a market in Ukraine.

items.title: At least 162 dead, local king missing after gunmen storm Nigerian village
items.summary: Government authorities are blaming "terrorist cells" for the violence in Africa's most populous country.

items.title: Australia announces Jakara Anthony, Matt Graham as 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics flag bearers
items.summary: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham have been named as flag bearers for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milano Cortina.

items.title: Bill Gates denies allegations in new Epstein files release
items.summary: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates denies ever visiting Jeffrey Epstein's private island after new claims surfaced following the release of files from a US government investigation into the late sex offender.

items.title: What is India’s Nipah virus and should Australians be worried?
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Two men face trial over string of alleged public shootings on the Mid North Coast
items.summary: A trial has commenced for two men and their alleged involvement in a string of public shootings on the New South Wales Mid North Coast.

items.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Second person charged after death of three-week-old baby south of Brisbane in 2024
items.summary: A 24-year-old woman has been charged with cruelty to children following a police investigation into the death of a newborn baby south of Brisbane in 2024.

items.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?
items.summary: Austin Appelbee, 13, has made international headlines after swimming for four hours in rough seas to save his mum, sister and brother stranded in the ocean. How did he do it?

items.title: Second inquest wraps up into the disappearance of escort Revelle Balmain at Kingsford in 1994
items.summary: An inquest has wrapped up into the disappearance of Sydney escort Revelle Balmain, 31 years after she was reported missing.

items.title: Raymond Reddington's trial told wife Sharon Fulton was murdered for insurance money
items.summary: Raymond Reddington failed to report his wife missing for several days, changed his story multiple times and wrote a fake confession letter to the state coroner, a Perth court hears.

items.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
items.summary: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

items.title: Living costs rise for all but some hit harder, new ABS data finds
items.summary: Cost-of-living pressures are being felt by all households, but some have been hit harder than others as annual costs increased between 2.3 and 4.2 per cent in 2025, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

items.title: Daly River residents being evacuated to Darwin ahead of predicted major flooding
items.summary: About 450 people are being evacuated from the remote Northern Territory town of Daly River, ahead of expected flood levels of more than 14 metres.

items.title: World's fastest falcon spotted in Central Australian outback for the first time
items.summary: The world's fastest falcon has been spotted in Central Australia for the first time, surprising even the seasoned birdwatcher who caught the rare sight on camera.

items.title: Mother issues urgent appeal as WA Police call off search for missing son, Zjaequaan Sebasio
items.summary: Zjaequaan Sebasio's family and WA Police are urging anyone with information about his location to come forward, after his disappearance almost a week ago.

items.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show
items.summary: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

items.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
items.summary: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

items.title: Why these women took marriage sabbaticals — and how it went
items.summary: Do you ever feel like taking a break from your marriage? Three women share how a marriage sabbatical changed their relationship.

items.title: Scammers staged a fake AFP set in a Cambodian compound. Here's what we know
items.summary: A fake AFP office staged by scammers who operated from a Cambodian scam centre reveals much about their tactics, experts say.

items.title: Banned tennis player Thomas Fancutt makes comeback after IV vitamin breach
items.summary: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

items.title: Humpty Doo locals help relocate crocodile from side of highway
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
items.summary: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

items.title: NSW parliamentary inquiry to investigate mould and maggot issues at Newcastle's Mater Hospital
items.summary: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

items.title: Trump's failure to extend nuclear treaty leaves door 'wide open' to arms race
items.summary: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between the United States and Russia has come to an end at a time of global instability.

items.title: Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim and India's Narendra Modi named in Epstein files
items.summary: The prime ministers of Malaysia and India deny having links with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein after their names appeared in a tranche of files released by the US Department of Justice.

items.title: Desperate need for medical evacuations in Gaza as Rafah crossing reopens
items.summary: Only five patients, along with their family members, exited through Rafah on the first day of its reopening, according to ABC staff inside Gaza. Doctors say it does not scratch the surface of the thousands of Palestinians who desperately need medical evacuation.

items.title: Melinda Gates reacts to allegations against ex-husband Bill Gates in new Epstein files
items.summary: Melinda French Gates says her ex-husband, Bill Gates, needs to answer for his behaviour alleged in the latest batch of Epstein files.

items.title: Melinda French Gates responds to Bill Gates allegations
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
items.summary: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

items.title: Report finds NT residents feel less safe and less satisfied with police despite crime crackdown
items.summary: A new report reveals NT residents felt less safe over the past year, despite a government crackdown on crime.

items.title: Ski racing event planned for SA's Lake Bonney cancelled amid permit requirement issues
items.summary: A ski racing event which was advertised to go ahead this weekend in South Australia's Riverland has been cancelled by organisers at the 11th hour.

items.title: Diamonds eye timely glimpse of Jamaica in Test series ahead of Commonwealth Games
items.summary: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

items.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
items.summary: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

items.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson
items.summary: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

items.title: Demons defender Steven May misses AFL pre-season training
items.summary: Melbourne Demons veteran Steven May was not at training for his club on Wednesday, just six weeks out from the start of the 2026 AFL season.

items.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
items.summary: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

items.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
items.summary: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

items.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
items.summary: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.

items.title: Queensland Police appeal for information as search continues for missing 70-year-old Dawn Wells
items.summary: A large-scale search operation is underway south of Brisbane as police intensify efforts to locate a "beloved community member" who went missing late last year.

items.title: Ley and Littleproud stand firm ahead of fresh round of Coalition reunion talks
items.summary: The Nationals leader has refused to disclose whether he will reject an offering for the Coalition to reunite with a list of conditions, including a six-month suspension from the frontbench for three Nationals senators.

items.title: Western Australia's oldest lighthouse at risk from rising sea levels in Geraldton
items.summary: The Point Moore lighthouse has kept seafarers safe along the unforgiving Batavia Coast since 1878, but a maritime historian says there needs to be a firm plan to protect it from future erosion and rising sea levels.

items.title: Travel blogger called out for visit to asbestos-ridden former Wittenoom town site with young daughter
items.summary: Asbestos disease advocates criticise a Queensland blogger for taking her daughter to one of Australia's most contaminated sites.

items.title: Greens link Hospitality Tasmania's donations to Liberals to pokies card demise
items.summary: The Tasmanian Greens have accused the state's peak hospitality group and the Liberal Party of a "political stitch-up" to kill off the proposed mandatory pokies card, after hundreds of thousands of dollars in donations were revealed.
